name: Conflux of Consequence
text: Forced – When this agenda advances, if it is act 2, 3, or 4: Skip the "b" side of this agenda and proceed directly to agenda 2a.
real_text: Forced – When this agenda advances, if it is act 2, 3, or 4: Skip the "b" side of this agenda and proceed directly to agenda 2a.
flavor: A coded message...
back_text:
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. I):
Leylines of paradimensional energy surround you, threatening to tear you apart.
Each enemy shifts each of their attached keys. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume the current phase).
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. II):
The portal the red-gloved man opened is almost shut! With no time left to prepare, you leap inside just before it closes.
Place 4 doom on agenda 2a. Advance the act.
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. III):
Extradimensional entities surround you, threatening to erase your very existence.
Flip 1 [per_investigator] keys from their [[Stable]] side to their [[Unstable]] side. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume with the current phase).

name: The World Unbidden
flavor: A coded message...
back_text:
Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them at random in the positions they were in.
Each investigator takes 2 damage and 2 horror but may either (choose one, or neither):
- Shift an [[Unstable]] key they control without flipping it to its [[Stable]] side to cancel all of the damage and horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
- Flip any number of [[Stable]] keys they control to their [[Unstable]] side to cancel that much damage/horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
back_flavor: A peal of thunder resounds across dimensions. In the deep recesses of your mind, the building pressure of infinite forgotten worlds crushes your every sense. Your keys, surging with paradimensional energy, rattle and hum in your hands. Without them, you could scarcely withstand the strain of this realm.

name: Running Red
flavor: A coded message...
back_text: Each investigator is defeated.
back_flavor: A coded message...

name: Secrets and Lies (v. I)
text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
real_text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
flavor: You have to find the man with the red gloves and discover what his plan is, but the remainder of the Red Coterie stands in your way. Don't they realize the true threat here?
back_text: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Remove the encounter deck and encounter discard pile from the game, replacing them with the second encounter deck.
back_flavor: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...

name: Secrets and Lies (v. II)
text: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective – Prepare for your journey into the Outside, and proceed when you are ready. At the end of any round, if each investigator is at the same location, they may advance. The sooner, the better. (Hint — You will also be forced to advance automatically when the agenda advances.)
real_text: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective – Prepare for your journey into the Outside, and proceed when you are ready. At the end of any round, if each investigator is at the same location, they may advance. The sooner, the better. (Hint — You will also be forced to advance automatically when the agenda advances.)
flavor: You have one last chance to explore the Red Coterie's hideout before you depart. But time is of the essence!
back_text: Remove agenda 1a from the game, moving all of its doom to agenda 2a. Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards and X decoys, where X is the amount of doom on agenda 2a, shuffle them facedown, and distribute them as evenly as possible around The Knotted Tower to its left, right, and below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Shuffle each other set-aside [[Coterie]] enemy into the encounter deck. (Note: From now on, draw cards from the encounter deck during each mythos phase, as normal.)
back_flavor: You step through the portal, uncertain if you will ever return...

name: Secrets and Lies (v. III)
text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
real_text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
flavor: Outsiders have attacked the Red Coterie's hideout! Only one among them has the answers you seek. You must find the "Red-Gloved Man" — or the entity that wears his face — and follow it back to the world whence it came.
back_text: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex.
back_flavor: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...

name: To the Tower
text: Locations and concealed mini-cards cannot be placed adjacent to [[Tower]] locations. Objective – Find a way into the tower where the infiltrator lies in wait. If an investigator enters the Gravity-Defying Climb, advance.
real_text: Locations and concealed mini-cards cannot be placed adjacent to [[Tower]] locations. Objective – Find a way into the tower where the infiltrator lies in wait. If an investigator enters the Gravity-Defying Climb, advance.
flavor: Beyond all of known reality, in the dimension known only to the forgotten and the forsaken, lies the preposterous City of Remnants — the home world of the Outsiders themselves. Looming before you, a terrifying, twisted tower of jumbled architecture is a nexus of roiling mist and clouds across an alien sky.
back_text:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Remove each City of Remnants in the shadows and the remainder of the Otherworld deck from the game.
Take the 3 City of Remnants concealed mini-cards and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around Gravity-Defying Climb in a random order.
back_flavor: Seven forgotten locks grant entry to the tower, each one a piece of history from a realm long since erased from time. You forget they exist the moment the gates open. On the other side, steps course their way up the spire's baffling length. Winding, perplexing, and seemingly infinite, the ascent to the apex of the tower that binds this world together is paradoxical, a Gordian knot twisted far too many times. Even if you make it to the top, you doubt you will ever find a way back.

name: The Ascent
text: Objective – Ascend. If an investigator enters The Towering Vertex, advance.
real_text: Objective – Ascend. If an investigator enters The Towering Vertex, advance.
flavor:
A terrible feeling of vertigo washes over you as you begin to scale the cyclopean, Escheresque steps.
Only one way to go now.
back_text:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Swap the set-aside Mimetic Nemesis enemy with The Red-Gloved Man enemy at The Towering Vertex.
Take the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card and 2 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Towering Vertex in a random order.
back_flavor: With herculean effort, you practically crawl from the final step to the tower's pinnacle. Twisting clouds of crimson and violet clash in a multidimensional sky, infinite gateways to infinite worlds, all of them oblivious, all of them blind, all of them theirs for the taking. You look out upon the world of the Outsiders with both awe and pity, upon the countless worlds' worth of ruin they have collected, discarded, forsaken, lost to all time. It is a garbage heap of cosmic proportions. At the very center lies your foe who has orchestrated humanity's erasure. Its body only scarcely resembles that of the Red-Gloved Man now. With no human face to wear, its gaze is empty, its expression unknowable.

name: The Final Err
text: [action] Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side: Remove an exposed decoy from the game. Objective – If Mimetic Nemesis is defeated, advance.
real_text: [action] Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side: Remove an exposed decoy from the game. Objective – If Mimetic Nemesis is defeated, advance.
flavor: You brandish the keys you have collected and brace yourself. If you cannot expel this entity and collapse this dimension, it will be the end of you all — and none will ever be the wiser. This is it. Your last chance before there is nothing of you left. nothing of you left nothing
back_flavor:
The entity collapses upon itself, its wordless screech washing over the world and worlds beyond, reverberating through your skull, tearing you apart molecule by molecule. You remain tethered to reality only by the energy of your keys, which endure even as all else implodes around you. There is a sensation of tugging at the back of your skull, a feeling of being yanked by a fishhook out of ravaged waters.
Then, darkness.

name: Scarlet Halls
text: [fast] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Move (to a connecting location).
real_text: [fast] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Move (to a connecting location).
flavor: Perhaps if you had a guide, these labyrinthine halls would not be so perplexing.
back_flavor: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.

name: Scarlet Halls
text: Forced – After you enter Scarlet Halls: For the remainder of your turn, as an additional cost for you to move from Scarlet Halls to a connecting location, you must either exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control or spend an additional action.
real_text: Forced – After you enter Scarlet Halls: For the remainder of your turn, as an additional cost for you to move from Scarlet Halls to a connecting location, you must either exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control or spend an additional action.
back_flavor: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.

name: Congress Chamber
text: [action] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an asset, draw it, and shuffle the rest into your deck.
real_text: [action] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an asset, draw it, and shuffle the rest into your deck.
flavor: The ceremonial chamber where your trial took place is dominated by an enormous table and lit by candlelight. Extravagant decorations adorn the walls, crimson in color.
back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.

name: Congress Chamber
text: While there is a ready [[Coterie]] enemy at Congress Chamber, increase the cost of each asset played by each investigator at Congress Chamber by 2.
real_text: While there is a ready [[Coterie]] enemy at Congress Chamber, increase the cost of each asset played by each investigator at Congress Chamber by 2.

back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.

flavor:
And o'er it all loomed the blasphemous effigy,
a ruinous testament to conquered worlds.
 – Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
back_flavor: In the nexus of this jumbled otherworld rises the tower: a sinister structure of assorted materials climbing out of the tangled city, looming countless stories over you like a skyscraper of forgotten architecture. An otherworldly mist snakes around the tower's length, flanked on all sides by barren, jagged peaks.

name: The Towering Vertex

real_text: Forced – When a concealed mini-card around The Towering Vertex is exposed: If it is... - ...the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card, deal the Mimetic Nemesis 3 damage, then flip all concealed mini-cards facedown and shuffle them facedown. - ...a decoy, it remains in play and exposed.
back_text: The Red-Gloved Man cannot be defeated. The way to The Towering Vertex is impossibly perplexing. In order for an investigator to enter The Towering Vertex, concealed mini-cards around Gravity-Defying Climb must be exposed in the following sequence: First, City of Remnants (L); second, City of Remnants (M); third, City of Remnants (R).

real_text: Forced - After you reveal Cliffs of Insanity: Move each concealed mini-card adjacent to it so they are arranged as evenly as possible in empty spots adjacent to locations not named Cliffs of Insanity.
back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.

name: Paradimensional Terror
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them facedown at random in the positions they were in. - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
real_text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them facedown at random in the positions they were in. - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.

name: The Red-Gloved Man
text: Retaliate. Forced - After you flip a key from its [[Unstable]] side to its [[Stable]] side: The Red-Gloved Man attacks you. Then, the Red-Gloved Man shifts each of his attached keys.
real_text: Retaliate. Forced - After you flip a key from its [[Unstable]] side to its [[Stable]] side: The Red-Gloved Man attacks you. Then, the Red-Gloved Man shifts each of his attached keys.
flavor: "So vou--remember. The final-err."

name: La Chica Roja
text: Aloof. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if La Chica Roja is unengaged: Move 1 resource from each investigator to her. She shifts each of her attached keys. [reaction] After La Chica Roja is defeated: Distribute her resources among the investigators, as you wish.

name: The Sanguine Watcher
subname: He Sees What Is Not There
text: Hunter. Forced - When you defeat The Sanguine Watcher: He shifts each of his attached keys twice.
real_text: Hunter. Forced - When you defeat The Sanguine Watcher: He shifts each of his attached keys twice.

name: The Claret Knight

name: Thorne
text: Hunter. Forced - After Thorne enters play: They shift each of their attached keys. [fast] Choose a key attached to your investigator and remove it from the game: Add Thorne to the victory display. Thorne is now the bearer of the chosen key. (Update the Campaign Log.)
real_text: Hunter. Forced - After Thorne enters play: They shift each of their attached keys. [fast] Choose a key attached to your investigator and remove it from the game: Add Thorne to the victory display. Thorne is now the bearer of the chosen key. (Update the Campaign Log.)

name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez
text: Patrol (nearest location with at least one other [[Coterie]] enemy). Forced - When another [[Coterie]] enemy at Desiderio Delgado Álvarez's location would take 1 or more damage: Deal that damage to him, instead. Then, he shifts each of his attached keys.
real_text: Patrol (nearest location with at least one other [[Coterie]] enemy). Forced - When another [[Coterie]] enemy at Desiderio Delgado Álvarez's location would take 1 or more damage: Deal that damage to him, instead. Then, he shifts each of his attached keys.

name: Amaranth
text: Hunter. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/ or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.
real_text: Hunter. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/ or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.

name: Tzu San Niang
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while fighting or attempting to evade Tzu San Niang: She shifts each of her attached keys.
real_text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while fighting or attempting to evade Tzu San Niang: She shifts each of her attached keys.

name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria
text: Aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator looks at the top card of their deck. Set each non-weakness card looked at in this way aside, out of play, as a hollow. If there is already a copy of that card set aside as a hollow, Aliki Zoni Uperetria shifts each of her attached keys.

name: Inspector Flint
text: [reaction] When you expose a decoy, exhaust Inspector Flint: Cancel the exposing of that decoy, flip it facedown and either draw 1 card or choose a different concealed mini-card at that location to expose.
real_text: [reaction] When you expose a decoy, exhaust Inspector Flint: Cancel the exposing of that decoy, flip it facedown and either draw 1 card or choose a different concealed mini-card at that location to expose.
flavor: If you know both yourself and your enemy, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss. - Sun Tzu

name: Agent Ari Quinn
text:
While there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you expose a card in the shadows, exhaust Agent Ari Quinn: Draw 1 card.
real_text:
While there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].

name: Dr. Dewi Irawan
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust Dr. Dewi Irawan: Either reveal a card from your hand to shuffle each copy of that card that is set-aside as a hollow into its owner's deck, or discard a card from your hand to shuffle any set-aside hollow into its owner's deck. In either case, gain 1 resource for each card shuffled in this way.

name: Expedited Ticket
text: Permanent. While embarking to a new destination on the map, you may exile Expedited Ticket and mark 1 time in your Campaign Log to travel anywhere on the map.
real_text: Permanent. While embarking to a new destination on the map, you may exile Expedited Ticket and mark 1 time in your Campaign Log to travel anywhere on the map.

name: Foundation Intel
text: Foundation Intel cannot leave your hand.
real_text: Foundation Intel cannot leave your hand.
flavor: This dossier, while filled with important findings, isn't related to your situation in the slightest. You should probably drop it off at the sanctum Taylor indicated at your earliest convenience.
